# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia function that cleans a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ .-]+" => "_")
end
```

This function first converts all characters in `col` to lower case and removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip()` function. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using a regular expression (`r"[ .-]+"`). The result is returned by the function. 

For example, when you call `clean_column("My Column")`, the output will be `"my_column"`.
